commitResults.messageTitle: Initial commit + gradle setup
commitResults.messageBody:
- Forked, cloned and setup duke project.
- Setup gradle with checkstyle and shadow plugins.
- Also added Junit dependency.
- Wrote a dummy Junit test for validation purposes.

commitResults.messageTitle: Created command pattern to execute user commands
commitResults.messageBody:
- created command interface
- created greet and echo command
- created utils package to handle printing
- configured Duke class to serve as program entry point

commitResults.messageTitle: Abstracted input parsing from echo command
commitResults.messageBody:
- created a new utils class to handle user input
- removed scanner instance from echo command

commitResults.messageTitle: Created MVC pattern to administer and display task list, added various new commands
commitResults.messageBody:
- Model is a simple list of strings at the moment
- Controller is instantiated in Duke and injected into commands for them to invoke the necessary changes
- Abstracted out display of goodbye message from EchoCommand
- Renamed EchoCommand to ListenCommand which is now in charge of listening to user input
- New AddCommand to add tasks
- New ListCommand to list tasks

commitResults.messageTitle: Fixed some indentation issues
Represented tasks with new Task class instead of string, made printing methods more readable
commitResults.messageBody:
- New task class with description and done boolean
- Use StringBuilder to form large strings to improve performance
- New output sequence that does not add a new line before second horizontal divider

commitResults.messageTitle: Reverted printing sequence
commitResults.messageBody:
Reason:
New printing sequence not intuitive. Client should not have to manually add a new line before the second horizontal divider.

commitResults.messageTitle: Created new command to mark tasks as done, created DukeMessage class to abstract formatting concerns from client, all printing of output now called in commands
commitResults.messageBody:
- output utils now takes DukeMessage as argument to print messages
- printing of messages still handled by output utils but is now called within execute method of Commands.
- TaskListView is now solely in charge of formatting duke messages

commitResults.messageTitle: Cleaned unnecessary import statements
Replaced tick and cross characters with ASCII values
Refactored Task to be an abstract class, created new classes that inherits from Task to meet the specifications, created a TaskKeyword enum
commitResults.messageBody:
- TaskKeyword enum contains functional interface to generate corresponding Task to avoid manual switch case
- Each Task contains a TaskKeyword field to enforce client to add new enum value when adding new Task
- Each controller method now returns a DukeMessage that represents the output of each operation to abstract View logic from commands

commitResults.messageTitle: Abstracted printing of output to view class, fixed some issues with output messages
Created chain of responsibility pattern where MainErrorHandler tries to delegate exceptions to appropriate handlers
commitResults.messageBody: - TaskException is an abstract class of exceptions related to the different tasks

commitResults.messageTitle: Created new UnknownCommandException, replaced generic error message
commitResults.messageBody: - UnknownCommandException thrown when user invalid command

commitResults.messageTitle: Added new command to handle delete requests, updated tasklistcontroller and tasklistview with the relevant methods
Added test for textUI
Testing issue tracker
Changed code to use method reference instead of lambda expression.

Created DukeStorage class to open storage based on configuration file - main driver now has a static final custom config file path which users can upload their configuration files to be read - if custom config file does not exist, default one in source directory will be used instead - config file contains path for storage fiel
commitResults.messageBody:
Todo:
- implement actually storage file reading
- create storage file as json

commitResults.messageTitle: Set up main driver to initialize DukeStorage, changed constructor of TaskListController to take existing list of tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
- DukeStorage is initialized by reading config file to find storage file path.

TODO:
- Change DukeStorage to read and write to storage file

commitResults.messageTitle: Set up DukeStorage to read data from storage file if it exists, if not create a new file
Implemented file saving
commitResults.messageBody:
- made tasks serializable in order to store task list as a byte stream
- removed default config file as it was redundant
- DukeStorage now finds and creates storage file based on user's home direc

commitResults.messageTitle: Set the default path to look for config file to bin of user's home directory, generated latest jar file
Fixed missing bye message
Refactored error handling, change datetime to be stored as a LocalDateTime
commitResults.messageBody: Reason: Probably a bad idea to have a "God class" to handle all errors, handling of errors should be done as and when appropriate

commitResults.messageTitle: Implemented find functionality
commitResults.messageBody:
- created new FindCommand
- refactored ListenCommand to listen for find keyword
- added method in TaskListController to find and display matching tasks

commitResults.messageTitle: Created new exception classes, wrote JUnit tests for each event class, added serialization uid to serializable classes to fix io error
commitResults.messageBody:
- new invalid arguments exception for when wrong arguments are passed into task constructors
- serializing uids required to properly read taks data after class changes

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactored code to follow java coding standard
Added javadoc coomments
Fixed some JavaDocs comments
Renamed view class
